>"I remind you, Zarak, that you and Jiaxus are our guest

ss" said coldyPerceptor "and not the Master of the house, so
>remember wher=
e is your place; Darkhawk, take this... Patetic bot to the

amber, you and Zarak take every piece of information that
>coudl be usefull=
, even if that means to use painful means; when you have a good
>amount of =
information we can go to take the matrix...

(SNIP)

Zarak straightened, cr=
ossing his arms over his chest as he coolly looked at Perceptor. "Of course=
" he said, the look on his face a cold blank mask, revealing nothing of the=
 inner turmoil he was dealing with. There was a part of him that wanted to =
blast the little Predacon for daring to tell him anything. But the ugly thi=
ng was that Zarak still needed the extra forces that Hydras and his Predaco=
ns brought to the table.

So rather than commanding his Scorponok unit to o=
pen fire on the base he just nodded and said, "I apologize, I have overstep=
ped my place."

Meanwhile Cyclonus and Scourge continued to face down Dark =
Rodimus, the air was tense as Dark Rodimus' optics stared into Cyclonus, ni=
ether of them ready to back down, both of them remembering the last battle =
they fought!

However it was Perceptor that broke the deadlock as he contin=
ued giving orders . . . 

(PASTE)

> The rest, we have to Keep an eye in ma=
ximal base things are becoming
> interesting lately there, Rodimus... I nee=
d you for task"

The affect of the command was almost instant as Rodimus st=
epped back from Cyclonus and Scourge and looked over at Perceptor. "What'ch=
a need Percy?" Rodimus said to Perceptor, happy for the moment that it was =
Perceptor and Hydras giving orders and not Cyclonus and his lap dog.

Cyclo=
nus, seeing the break in the tension also stepped back, pulling Scourge bac=
k with him. "There will be another time Scourge." he said quietly, "No need=
 to fight this out here."

Scourge nodded, "Yes, there will be." he said da=
rkly. His optics still watched Rodimus, his look almost hungry as he smiled=
 evilly.

As the tensions between Cyclonus, Scourge and Rodimus cooled Zara=
k turned to look at Tuscon, wondering what information this bot could hold.=
 "Come" Zarak said to Darkhawk, "Let's see what this Auto . . . "

*BEEP*

=
Zarak was caught in mid sentence by his scanner going off, the hand held on=
e that he had been keeping trained on Tuscon. He glanced down at it, a curi=
ous look on his face. For some reason it was registering a life sign where =
there had been none before. It was located somewhere near Tuscon's head.

Z=
arak stepped forward to take a more careful scan . . .

(TAG)
